awd_titl_txt: Integrated Study of Source, Path and Site Effects on        Northridge Ground Motions
awd_abstract_narration: 9416223  Anderson    This research is to understand the site, source and path effect  of the Northridge earthquake for strong motion prediction and  seismic hazard reduction in the Los Angeles region.  Preliminary  work on a composite source model generated very realistic synthetic  strong motion seismograms at several locations.  This work will be  continued and completed for several strong ground motion parameters  including peak acceleration and velocity, and Fourier and response  spectral amplitudes.  Then the work will focus on finding the  optimal source model parameters and concentrate on site effects,  expressed as a Fourier spectral ratio of weak motions in  aftershocks to predicted ground motions for a flat-layered half  space.  This contrasts with the more usual reference, for spectral  ratios, of a nearby rock station or a network average.  This  project is a contribution to the National Earthquake Hazard  Reduction Program and is supported by the Northridge Earthquake  Emergency Appropriation.  ***
